name: Mainframe
description: Basic commands for the Mainframe cli subsystem layers

Job Entry Subsystem 2 (JES2).val: Display all jobs using 5% or more of the spool
Release all jobs
Activate new functions at the current release level of JES2
Dynamically define a VTAM application to JES2 at the specified JES2 node.
Dynamically define a symbolic name for a JES2 route code.
Dynamically define a functional subsystem (FSS) to JES2
Dynamically add a line
Creates a new LOGON pseudo-device, which defines JES2 as an application program to VTAM
Dynamically add a local printer
Specify redirection for commands entered at the entry console
Add one or more RJE workstations
Cancel the processing of all or specified automatic command entries and delete those entries
Cancel auto job id=3
Immediately cancel jobs or TSU sessions currently executing on any member of the MAS and, if desired, provide a storage dump.
Display information about currently active jobs
Display the current values of all parameters defined on the BUFDEF initialization statement or command
Display the Status of Spool Volumes
Display the JES2 spooling environment characteristics
Display active list every 15 minutes
Start job TMSDAILY every 24 hours starting at 0415 hours
Start job BACKUP every 24 hours starting at 0115 hours
Varys offline devices 234,235,236 and displays all at JES2 startup

Multiple Virtual Storage (MVS).val: Display IOS control unit group information
Display PARMLIB data sets and volumes Information
Display Entries in the List of APF-Authorized Libraries
Display storage group status using the DISPLAY SMS command
Display assigned name of the systems
Set TSO user to max of one user
Display info on the couple data sets, which used at IPL, names, DASD, etc
Activate the console you are on

Data Facility System Managed Storage (DF.val: Reports caching statistics for both caching approaches of catalog management to cache catalog information
This new modify catalog command reports counts for various events and the average elapsed time for these events
Detail information and used in real-time diagnosis when problems arise

Time Sharing Option/Extensions (TSO/E).val: Command to initialize SYS1.BRODCAST data set and to synchronize it with the RACF data set, SYS1.UADS, or both
List all kinds of info on your system (by using ISPF).

Virtual Telecommunications Access Method.val: Display the all active nodes in the domain
Take down VTAM normally but not allowing LU sessions to end normally
Take down VTAM when the above 2 options fail. Cancel will kill everything whether they are in Pending states
Display information about VTAM buffer used

System Display and Search Facility (SDSF.val: Typing this command on the line of the job you want to save as a data set. It displays a self explaining menu. Your job is NOT remove for the output queue
